DataElement.preferredName: Malignant Neoplasm Specimen Availability Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded indicator response regarding whether specimen is available from either archival sources or from newly obtained tissue.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: related to access or readiness for use for a sample of tumor tissue composed of atypical neoplastic cells collected for research

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues.  Malignant neoplasms usually metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision.  The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin's and non-Hodgkin's lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas. -- 2004:Specimen; a bit of tissue or blood or urine that is taken or used for research purposes.

Concepts.definition: A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.

A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

Property.preferredDefinition: Available; obtainable or accessible and ready for use or service.

Concepts.definition: The quality of being obtainable or accessible and ready for use or service.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

DataElementConcept.origin: COG CRF:Children's Oncology Group Case Report Form
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Changed from CTEP to COG for by script Thu Jan 2 10:00:57 EST 2014

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Is a tumor specimen available?
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is a tumor specimen available?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is archival tissue available or newly obtained core or excisional biopsy of a tumor lesion?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is tissue available for PD-L1 expression?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is archived or fresh tumor sample available?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have archival tumor specimen available for submission?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is sufficient archived tumor tissue from prior tumor biopsy or surgical resection available for submission to complete molecular profiling?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is tissue available for correlative studies?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is baseline tumor tissue, either fresh (preferred) or from paraffin block/unstained slides if contemporary biopsy is unsafe or not otherwise obtainable from the primary tumor site or metastatic site to be available for use on correlative studies?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is sufficient tumor tissue available for the required biology study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is enrolled in the first stage of Cohort B, is there accessible pre-treatment and post-treatment (4-6 weeks) tumor for biopsy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is TCC tumor tissue available for submission in a form of at least 10 unstained slides or FFPE block (FFPE block highly recommended and preferred)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is tissue available from primary and/or recurrent disease to evaluate tumor expression of NY-ESO-1 or PDL1 by IHC and/or RT-PCR, and for measurement of DNA methylation?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient able to provide tissue from a recent (within 6 weeks of study entry) archival tissue sample or newly obtained core or excisional biopsy of a tumor lesion?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is archival tissue for correlative studies available?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is archival tissue for correlative analysis available?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 13
ReferenceDocuments.description: Unless the prescreening was performed at Yale Clinical Molecular Pathology Lab (UCMPL), is TCC tumor tissue available for submission in a form of at least 10 unstained slides or FFPE block (FFPE block highly recommended and preferred) along with a buccal swab?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 14
ReferenceDocuments.description: Unless the prescreening was performed at Yale Clincial Molecualr Pathology Lab (YCMPL), is TCC tumor tissue available for submission in a form of at least 10 unstained slides or FFPE block (FFPE block highly recommended and preferred) along with a buccal swab?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 15
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient provided tissue from an archival tumor sample (obtained within 2 years from screening visit) or newly obtained core, punch, or excisional biopsy of a tumor lesion if deemed relatively safe and technically feasible?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 16
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has specimen been obtained to determine IDH mutation status?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 18
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has a tumor specimen obtained from relapsed metastatic or local advanced disease (if applicable) been submitted?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 17
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had at least one prior surgery with available archival formalin-fixed paraffin-embedded (FFPE) tumor blocks of the initial or recurrent meningioma?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 19
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is tumor tissue (paraffin-embedded tissue block or tumor tissue on unstained glass slides) available for fusion FISH analysis at Cleveland Clinic?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is adequate surgical tumor tissue available for external molecular diagnostics and confirmatory profiling?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 20
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is a tumor tissue specimen available to be provided (archival or prospective, from a medically necessary surgery, biopsy, or excision) for molecular profiling including TMB analysis?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was tumor tissue submitted for diagnostic pathology review?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was archival tumor tissue submitted for the genotyping?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have tumor tissue from a prior resection?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 21
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is archival tumor tissue specimen or slides available for submission to Moffitt Tissue core Lab, Moffitt Cancer Center?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text_1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is adequate surgical tumor tissue available and could be provided for molecular diagnostics and confirmatory profiling?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Were specimens submitted for the Molecular Characterization Initiative?

DataElement.administrativeNotes: 5/11/22 cjl added AQT and SN for COG
